reviews.author: Manu Yáñez

reviews.text: Cooper captures those personal demons with confidence without ever leaving aside the charming external facet of the character. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mikel Zorrilla

reviews.text: A Star is Born defines Lady Gaga as a film actress, and Cooper as a filmmaker.
reviews.author: Kirk Baird

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper wants to make you cry. And if you give him a chance by going to see "A Star Is Born," he's gonna do it.
reviews.author: Charles Ealy

reviews.text: Not everything works in Cooper's version of "A Star Is Born" But enough does to ensure that this film is, indeed, one of the best releases of 2018. Maybe, even, of this decade.
reviews.author: Dan Webster

reviews.text: Somehow, though, the bloat is almost appropriate in a story about excesses, and the devastating pitfalls of fame. "A Star is Born" portrays both poignantly, movingly, well.
reviews.author: Randy Myers

reviews.text: Cooper has given us a vision of this story to cherish.
reviews.author: Jason Di Rosso

reviews.text: The A Star Is Born story construction has worked, again and again, because it's archetypal tragedy - nobody believes there's a happy ending in sight. But Cooper still earned every one of my tears.
reviews.author: April Wolfe

reviews.text: It's heartfelt, well-paced, and gut-wrenchingly tragic, with the gorgeous music and two main characters taking centre stage by grabbing hold of the audience's emotion until the very last second.
reviews.author: Heather Gunn

reviews.text: This is the first version of A Star is Born in the digital age and in order for this story to work for modern audiences, there had to be plausible dimensions between the fame and the relationship between the leads. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fernanda Solórzano

reviews.text: But are we still supposed to celebrate a film that posits the male ego as too fragile to accept a woman who equals or surpasses him? Or that a woman's "authenticity" will only truly flower in response to a man's sacrifice?
reviews.author: Graeme Tuckett

reviews.text: Crucially, the film never feels inauthentic and the songs remain both organically integrated and highly memorable. Rarely has a film's story benefited so much from its musical elements.
reviews.author: Dominic Corry

reviews.text: Lady Gaga has created a delicate, likeable character who serves as the film's emotional barometer in that as her feelings change, so too will those of the audience.
reviews.author: Matthew Toomey

reviews.text: While imperfect, A Star Is Born is a satisfying and emotionally evocative epic. If only it had managed to maintain the intoxicating allure of its first hour.
reviews.author: Wenlei Ma

reviews.text: It may not be a daringly original piece. But when the end result is this engaging, entertaining, and heartbreaking, it demands to be called one of the year's finest films.
reviews.author: Doug Jamieson

reviews.text: The movie's gender dynamics remain fully intact from its 1937 origins. Ally is controlled and manipulated by powerful men from start to finish, and some of the more emotionally abusive scenes can be disturbing to watch.
reviews.author: Li Lai

reviews.text: The chemistry shared by Gaga and Cooper - whether on stage during the movie's dynamic live music sequences, or casually swapping lines walking along a street - is at once appealing, involving and concerning.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: The vital music scenes are convincing and enjoyably infectious, the romance is beautifully played, and [Cooper] doesn't hold back when the story takes its long-expected turn for the worse.
reviews.author: Matthew Bond

reviews.text: This is a movie to gush over, to see again, to buy the soundtrack to, to urge others to see, to dream about ... Watch it sweep the Oscars, too. I'll be fine with that.
reviews.author: CJ Johnson

reviews.text: The very story of A Star is Born is itself a cautionary tale. Interestingly, Hollywood loves this story. The Cooper and Gaga version is the fourth time the tale is told.
reviews.author: Diana Cheng

reviews.text: A Star Is Born is a remake that is good enough to stand on its own without the fear of comparison.
reviews.author: Saibal Chatterjee

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper delivers a stunning and heartbreaking rendition of the Hollywood musical.
reviews.author: Soumya Srivastava

reviews.text: A Star is Born doesn't push any cinematic boundaries. It isn't edgy or provocative. But it's emotionally rich and hugely satisfying.
reviews.author: Anupama Chopra

reviews.text: Cooper, who has turned director with the film, extracts commendable performances from everybody in the cast. The life of a musician is caught perfectly.
reviews.author: Devesh Sharma

reviews.text: Overall, A Star Is Born is melodrama at its best, an emotional manipulation that works even if you're not normally a sucker for that type of thing.
reviews.author: Jordan Calhoun

reviews.text: It's been recited plenty of times before and, even if it hadn't, follows the predictable beats of so many true stories of waning celebrity. That's not a criticism; it's actually what gives the story emotional heft.
reviews.author: Simon Miraudo

reviews.text: If [Cooper] was going for middlebrow musical melodrama in the vein of "The Rose" and "The Bodyguard," bullseye.
reviews.author: J. Olson

reviews.text: What kept me from appreciating this movie as a whole beyond some very good parts was its inability to practice what it preached and actually say something.
reviews.author: Rich Juzwiak

reviews.text: A breath of fresh air. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Rafael Rosales Santos

reviews.text: But there's undeniable passion, talent and naked humanity onscreen, and for much of its run-time, A Star Is Born is impressively rapturous and romantic.
reviews.author: Roe McDermott

reviews.text: Is it worth seeing? Absolutely. They don't make 'em like this anymore.
reviews.author: Sean Collier

reviews.text: So much better than the Streisand version.
reviews.author: Bob Grimm

reviews.text: I will add to the chorus of praise for Gaga. She's the film's real MVP-a natural actor of surprising depth and soul.
reviews.author: Aaron Yap

reviews.text: Lady Gaga, in her first big-screen performance, acquits herself well in a role that mirrors her real-life self. There's a definite on-screen frisson between her and co-star Bradley Cooper.
reviews.author: Richard James Havis

reviews.text: [The ending] was a very romanticized view of what a toxic relationship is, and I wasn't here for it.
reviews.author: Lauren Humphries-Brooks

reviews.text: Classic Musical With Magnificent Performances
reviews.author: Diana Saenger

reviews.text: The performances are sound. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Hugo Hernández Valdivia

reviews.text: Some of the best performances of the year...Cooper is going to be a great director if he can continue this kind of filmmaking momentum.
reviews.author: Chris Stuckmann

reviews.text: If you're able to forget the stars that have gone before, A Star is Born is a very professional tear-jerker with some very loud music, and for many that will be enough.
reviews.author: David Stratton

reviews.text: The star who is being born through this film is its actor-director.
reviews.author: Nandini Ramnath

reviews.text: [Director Bradley Cooper] intelligently allows music to exist almost as a character and dedicates whole sequences to musical acts. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge Iván Morales

reviews.text: A Star Is Born is something that's easy to fall in love with but not all too deeply. Not perfect cinema, but maybe that's enough for now.
reviews.author: Tatat Bunnag

reviews.text: This is a not-to-be-missed film and shows that Cooper is a certifiable director, while Gaga shows that acting is not just a fling and solidifies her as a true triple threat.
reviews.author: Jamal Grootboom

reviews.text: However, after some songs, A Star is Born not only begins to repeat the formula of other films such as La La Land but to repeat itself. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Daniel Krauze

reviews.text: Watch as these two great artists dive in. Oh, the treasures they dig up together. Once the movie lifts off (with this very song) it never meets the ground again.
reviews.author: Nathaniel Rogers

reviews.text: The performances from Gaga, Elliott, and Cooper are amazing. This feature shows a lot of promise for a first-time director like Cooper.
reviews.author: Alan French

reviews.text: Lady Gaga is a natural; Ally is talented and cursed with the insecurity that is talent's twin. Her face glows with natural beauty, not manufactured and not afraid of the camera's intrusions. There is chemistry there ...
reviews.author: Andrew L. Urban

reviews.text: Electric, compelling and tender, the film is a knockout creatively and emotionally, offering a raw glimpse into today's world of celebrity.
reviews.author: Louise Keller

reviews.text: Cooper's latest remake of A Star is Born has its high points but, in the end, it's disappointing and unnecessary. Let's hope it is the last version.
reviews.author: Loren King

reviews.text: What Cooper gets about A Star Is Born is the degree to which it is about the physics of love and work. This may be the only mythic narrative about a two-career marriage. It's a melodrama where every action has an equal and opposite reaction.
reviews.author: Carrie Rickey

reviews.text: We don't get genuine character development or insight into the industry or kitschy fun.
reviews.author: Beth Accomando

reviews.text: Fused with laugh-out-loud humour, even at the most uncomfortable moments, A Star is Born is driven by a searing authenticity that makes it feel like a biopic.
reviews.author: Marwa Hamad

reviews.text: Nearly every moment of A Star Is Born feels real and specific. Often painfully so.
reviews.author: Megan Basham

reviews.text: For its first hour-plus, A Star Is Born captures the exhilaration of new love and new creation better than any movie in years.
reviews.author: Margot Harrison

reviews.text: While Lady Gaga shines, the problematic narrative makes it clear that it is the unlikable Jackson Maine with whom audiences are supposed to identify.
reviews.author: Kimberly Pierce

reviews.text: Well, ladies and gentlemen, this duo makes A Star Is Born a new version that will be considered a classic. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Pablo O. Scholz

reviews.text: What could have been a series of vain decisions... ends up being a deeply moving love story. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Emmanuel Báez

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper has something new to say in this version, and Lady Gaga belts it out loud and clear to make this a definite contender in numerous categories during awards season.
reviews.author: Neil Soans

reviews.text: You can't be a one-named artist if your name is not something like Beyonce, Rihanna, Prince or Adele. You just can't.
reviews.author: Matt Pais

reviews.text: Love story about two musicians finding it difficult to believe in themselves and their unique voices.
reviews.author: Frederic and Mary Ann Brussat

reviews.text: One of the best things that this contemporary version of A Star Born does is taking the conventions of the previous incarnations and transforming them into a truly profound experience. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Juanma Fernández París

reviews.text: Both leads are fine, albeit one-note, and cinematographer Matthew Libatique supplies some sharp images, but the movie is pervasively musty and false, with some brutally bad songs to boot.
reviews.author: Daniel Barnes

reviews.text: ... the distraction-free bubble focuses the story on the key players and their emotional motivations to achieve maximum impact... (but) the real villain of this story is human fragility.
reviews.author: Kevin A. Ranson

reviews.text: It may be that every generation gets the "A Star Is Born" it deserves, though what we did to deserve this one is anyone's guess.
reviews.author: John Anderson

reviews.text: The obvious question to ask is 'Why go and see A Star Is Born for the fourth time?' Because, essentially, this film steers the same narrative path from previous installments (almost too closely). The answer is easy: her name is Lady Gaga.
reviews.author: Nate Adams

reviews.text: [It's] a crowd-pleaser and many may not even notice the film cheats them of a more fulfilling ending since it already runs 135 minutes and the soundtrack is a rewarding distraction.
reviews.author: Sarah Gopaul

reviews.text: A Star Is Born invites inside the rarest of bubbles and helps us grasp the intense pressure that comes with having to perform. The biggest names often hide the most vulnerable souls.
reviews.author: Christopher Lloyd

reviews.text: Cooper's best decision was casting Lady Gaga and himself as the leads.
reviews.author: Greg Maki

reviews.text: Cooper conveys the love between both with craft in his directorial debut. But also the fears and miseries that accompany success: Absences, lies and ridicule shift the focus of its predecessors. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Rolando Gallego

reviews.text: Fuelled by scintillating performances and a stellar soundtrack, A Star Is Born is a magnificent achievement that will capture the hearts of almost everyone that it touches.
reviews.author: Matt Hudson

reviews.text: This is the best film of the year.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: Lady Gaga shines brightly, while Bradley Cooper is phenomenal. Superior to all previous versions. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fico Cangiano

reviews.text: Cooper simmers with swagger before Gaga's vocal force boils the cauldron over, taking everything to another level.
reviews.author: Don Shanahan

reviews.text: Bradly Cooper and Lady Gaga electrify the screen. Backed by a first-rate supporting cast and well-written songs, this is by far the best version of the timeless classic.
reviews.author: Joe Friar

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga sing loud in one of the year's best films.
reviews.author: Matt Rodriguez

reviews.text: It may be a fourth version of this time honored showbiz saga but Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga make 'A Star Is Born' all their own- and that's a very good thing.
reviews.author: Pete Hammond

reviews.text: Co-written by Cooper, who also helped write some of the film's music, the script doesn't exactly bubble with wit but it doesn't have to. What matters is that it gives both leads the chance to charm one another - and us.
reviews.author: Sandra Hall

reviews.text: As Ally Campana, a gem in the rough, Lady Gaga is dynamite.
reviews.author: Diane Carson

reviews.text: It's well worth seeing and marks Gaga and Cooper as two people who have the talent to overcome fame and endure for the long haul.
reviews.author: Carl Kozlowski

reviews.text: At its huge, pulsating heart this is a story about lovers desperately trying to save one another - from the loss of integrity in an industry that disdains it and from self-destructive impulses with roots too old and deep to be touched.
reviews.author: Matthew Norman

reviews.text: This update is less anguished, has better songs and, even at 135 minutes, is actually shorter than the last two.
reviews.author: Ken Eisner

reviews.text: When [Lady Gaga] starts singing, grab your tissues and hold onto your seat.
reviews.author: Martin Thomas

reviews.text: I heard that it was [Cooper] singing but I didn't want to believe it... ain't no way God gave everybody all that.
reviews.author: Korey Coleman

reviews.text: Not only has [Cooper] made something old new again, he's reinvented it and improved upon it. It's a passion project that shoots for the stars and is likely to strike Oscar gold.
reviews.author: Tom Meek

reviews.text: It's like settling into the cinematic equivalent of a Lexus 450. The picture is big and lush and smooth.
reviews.author: Eleanor Ringel Cater

reviews.text: ...the juggling act that all remakes strive for, but few manage to capture. Encore!
reviews.author: Cain Noble-Davies

reviews.text: This is a relationship that I cared about, and that's rare.
reviews.author: Tony Baker

reviews.text: An exhilarating, bittersweet romance...
reviews.author: Susan Granger

reviews.text: [Cooper's] talent for writing and directing has been hiding in plain sight. After this five-star treat of a picture, consider the secret out.
reviews.author: Alison Rowat

reviews.text: A Star Is Born may not reinvent the wheel in terms of cinematic art, but it's a knockout in just about every other way that matters: it has heart and soul, great chemistry between its leads and some killer musical numbers.
reviews.author: Tom Shone

reviews.text: Cooper's directorial debut [proves] that he has what it takes to write, act, direct, and even sing, but even more important, he knows how to assemble the right cast of characters to create a beautiful story worth re-telling for the 4th (or 5th) time.
reviews.author: Pamela Powell

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper crushes it... He's a great comedic actor, a great dramatic actor. And he's great in this movie -- also a great director.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jahns

reviews.text: Sturdy, old-fashioned... Gaga's powerhouse voice is one of the film's key assets... Packs an emotional wallop by focusing on these two faces and voices.
reviews.author: Eric D. Snider

reviews.text: The problem is whenever Cooper turns the film away from his best asset (Gaga) and into a vanity production.
reviews.author: Gary M. Kramer

reviews.text: It's a film that simply works with a simple plot and entertains with action scenes and effects. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Abigail Camarillo

reviews.text: A Star is Born, perhaps, is a less "rosy" version of La La Land. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mauricio Nava

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper's 2018 rendition of A Star Is Born manages the impossible: bringing this seemingly old-fashioned story about fame into the present while retaining its classical, timeless appeal.
reviews.author: Alison Herman

reviews.text: What Cooper persuasively depicts is the fear factor of stardom-the sense of vulnerability, of a position that's both powerful and fragile.
reviews.author: Richard Brody

reviews.text: A Star Is Born is entertaining, gut-wrenching, and exceptional; with spectacular performances and a top-notch soundtrack, this rock-musical becomes an instant classic.
reviews.author: Lauren Bradshaw

reviews.text: Expect nominations all around, with actor/writer/director/producer and songwriter Cooper on the verge of a boatload, maybe even for contributing to an eclectic, sure-to-be-soaring soundtrack.
reviews.author: John Urbancich

reviews.text: Cooper finds a new voice too, as a director. The actor understands how to stage a scene (as well as stage a literal stage-the concert scenes are stunning) in ways that, like the acting, feel instinctive.
reviews.author: Adam Epstein

reviews.text: I'm usually the first to ask, "Do we really need another reboot?" But in the case of this spectacular cinematic event, the answer is a passionate "Yes! Yes! Oh YES!"
reviews.author: Lisa Johnson Mandell

reviews.text: If you're entering the theatre simply desiring a couple solid musical numbers, then your $15 will not have been spent in vain. Unfortunately, outside of its music, the movie falls flat as only a two-dimensional vignette of common misogyny can.
reviews.author: Kim Selling

reviews.text: As deep and resonant as Bradley Cooper's drawl, and as bright as Lady Gaga's screen future.
reviews.author: Mark Kermode

reviews.text: It has weight and depth, and that, as Cooper seems to intuitively understand, adds heft to the story's melodramatic complications.
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: The directing debut for the actor Bradley Cooper is a good one.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: Gaga is good but Bradley Cooper is definitely the star of "A Star Is Born". Also worthy of strong praise are Sam Elliott and Andrew Dice Clay.
reviews.author: Jackie K. Cooper

reviews.text: Cooper obviously overlooks a potential jackpot in a co-star eager to prove she's not just another poker face. Despite those restraints, she's ultimately his savior, displaying enough moxie and heart to engage, even when the movie fails to match the hype .
reviews.author: Al Alexander

reviews.text: The best compliment I can give the new version of A Star is Born is that I didn't mind it. The harshest word is "forgettable.
reviews.author: Leonard Maltin

reviews.text: Can a contrived and shallow love story remain afloat on charisma alone? Not in this case.
reviews.author: Avi Offer

reviews.text: A Star Is Born... delivers a sprawling relationship drama that fully captures a realistic picture of love.
reviews.author: Mike Reyes

reviews.text: Cooper has borrowed [from the 1976 Barbra Streisand verson] the rock 'n' roll backdrop and pedestrian dialogue and, in some ways, its 1970s setting.
reviews.author: Kent Turner

reviews.text: Undeniably, "A Star is Born" shines due to the realistic chemistry between Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga. This Oscar worthy film delivers on all fronts!
reviews.author: Sarah Knight Adamson

reviews.text: The actors' performances are often raw and improvisatory, like something out of a 1970s movie.
reviews.author: Noel Murray

reviews.text: This movie has everything: a swept-off-your-feet romantic fantasy, an underdog-makes-good journey, a wrenching substance abuse drama, and an industry cautionary tale combined.
reviews.author: Alison Willmore

reviews.text: A sometimes exhilarating, occasionally frustrating, and always cunning Hollywood product that can feel like a battle of wills between two deliberately self-deprecating artists.
reviews.author: Michael Koresky

reviews.text: "A Star is Born" never sacrifices the conviction of its earliest moments, which so smartly connect these characters as artists and humans while also upholding the sanctity of their individual journeys.
reviews.author: Robert Levin

reviews.text: Melodrama gets a bad rap sometimes.
reviews.author: Linda Holmes

reviews.text: Despite its long history and many incarnations, Cooper manages to bring something that feels authentic and new to the table with his iteration of this classic film story.
reviews.author: Kt Schaefer

reviews.text: it's not a particularly great or profound movie, but it's a hugely enjoyable one, with so many amazing scenes that it hardly matters whether they add up to anything.
reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Anderson

reviews.text: A Star Is Born is one journey with so many emotions working in perfect harmony that should not be missed.
reviews.author: Liam Hanlon

reviews.text: It could win Best Picture, and I wouldn't complain if it did.
reviews.author: Mark Ellis

reviews.text: Everything that it does, it does really well...a slow burn, the length really didn't bother me...
reviews.author: Steph Cozza

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper directs this movie like he's doing just what he is, conducting and playing first chair at the same time, Gaga is a force of nature. She's a revelation in this movie of course, but [Cooper] also knows how to play directly into her strengths.
reviews.author: Roth Cornet

reviews.text: A Star Is Born tells a story many of us already know. The magic comes from the fact that we utterly forget we know it and become absorbed all over again.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: Mark A Star is Born as the film that crowns Lady Gaga as a powerful and winning screen presence, and Bradley Cooper as a first-rate director and born-again movie star.
reviews.author: Stephen Rebello

reviews.text: Germanotta is not Falconetti, but oh, that face in close-up, it is canvas, flesh, odalisque: Matthew Libatique's nimble camera rightfully worships Lady Gaga. She is nothing less than a marvel.
reviews.author: Ray Pride

reviews.text: Powerful and moving and thought-provoking stuff in an old-fashioned Hollywood romance with a sensational soundtrack featuring two of the year's breakout performances.
reviews.author: Annlee Ellingson

reviews.text: The duo have decent chemistry together, it must be said, but it becomes less believable as the film progresses.
reviews.author: Piers Marchant

reviews.text: Cooper delivers a weightless version of the story. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Miguel Muñoz Garnica

reviews.text: One can't help being impressed by Cooper's achievement here, making this chestnut of a story feel fresh and vital.
reviews.author: Randall King

reviews.text: Soulful, honest and heart-breaking.
reviews.author: Ross Miller

reviews.text: A big crowd pleaser with genuine thrills, even if second half flags.
reviews.author: James Verniere

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper's A Star is Born is a transcendent feast for the eyes and ears.
reviews.author: Millicent Thomas

reviews.text: Gaga's role might not seem like much of a stretch. But the best parts of her performance are during the first half of the movie when she's playing against type, convincing the spellbound audience that she is not an internationally recognizable pop idol...
reviews.author: Lindsay Zoladz

reviews.text: A Star Is Born is the living embodiment of going for it, one of the least humble, least self-conscious, least self-aware movies in recent memory-and maybe one of the best.
reviews.author: Sean Fennessey

reviews.text: My impeccable taste and preferences aside, you should check it out for yourself.
reviews.author: Barry Paris

reviews.text: It's essentially multiplex-friendly porn, where you discover that you desperately need two pretty celebrities you never considered falling in love to fall in love.
reviews.author: Vincent Mancini

reviews.text: A Star Is Born has little insight into where stars come from and even less into how they disappear.
reviews.author: Kyle Smith

reviews.text: This oft-told tale (this is the fourth telling of the story) falls into an all-too-predictable rhythm in the middle of the movie, which becomes a slog in the third and final act.
reviews.author: Michael Heaton

reviews.text: The first half of this new take on the story is incredible.
reviews.author: Sara Michelle Fetters

reviews.text: There's real vitality in Cooper's direction in the early passages, and, in the performances of the costars, an understanding of the ravages of romance that justifies putting ourselves through the paces of this sad story yet again.
reviews.author: Peter Rainer

reviews.text: I believed Bradley Cooper was a man who writes Soundgarden songs but dresses like Sturgill Simpson. I believed Lady Gaga was Joe Biden's daughter. I never wanted it to end.
reviews.author: Katie McDonough

reviews.text: It's all a bit overamped, an entertainment that's a little too in love with itself to bring down the curtain -- even as its two-hour and 15-minute length begins to wear.
reviews.author: Robert Denerstein

reviews.text: This fourth rendition better be the last because you can't really step it up from here. If you aren't a "Little Monster" by now, "A Star is Born" will convert you.
reviews.author: Rendy Jones

reviews.text: Here we have a film that is as accomplished as they come; a muscular, note-perfect, old-fashioned, cinematic event that longs to be experienced on the big screen - preferably, one with a stellar sound system.
reviews.author: Chris Wasser

reviews.text: Gaga is so good in A Star Is Born and on so many levels that she single-handedly justifies its existence.
reviews.author: Paul Whitington

reviews.text: It's the love story for our time. It's an instant cult classic. It's everything a tasteful move should not be, and yet it's an undeniable success.
reviews.author: Jo Livingstone

reviews.text: The high-voltage ghost of Judy Garland haunts every frame and illuminates every shadow in the film, and Lady Gaga seems to know it.
reviews.author: Rex Reed

reviews.text: The film's musical scene are truly sensational. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Laura Hiros

reviews.text: A Star is Re-Born? This is the 4th time this one has been made and it's still more a star is boring than A Star is Born.
reviews.author: Gary Wolcott

reviews.text: Cooper's gamble - both in stepping in behind the camera and giving Lady Gaga her first starring film role - has paid off handsomely.
reviews.author: Daniel M. Kimmel

reviews.text: Cooper, Lady Gaga shine in tragic story of love, addiction.
reviews.author: Sandie Angulo Chen

reviews.text: The elegance with which Bradley Cooper solves the tragic end of the protagonist in his directorial debut seems to anticipate that after this debut there is not only trade, but a truly talent. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jordi Costa

reviews.text: If 2011's The Artist was an homage, this is more of a burlesque, a hot mess of a movie that takes its dramatic cues from the camp excesses of the drag queens among whom our hammered hero finds the lucky Lady.
reviews.author: Matthew Lickona

reviews.text: And whatever tears you may shed at the end feel entirely earned, as is one's respect for a movie far better than one might have imagined: a film director is born.
reviews.author: Matt Wolf

reviews.text: If you've been hearing good things about "A Star is Born," believe them all.
reviews.author: Tom Santilli

reviews.text: It's a film that's wise to what it means to be famous in 2018 as well as old-fashioned movie entertainment, with gangbusters musical numbers and an effective and appealing love story between its two leads. And it will make Lady Gaga a movie star.
reviews.author: Rob Thomas

reviews.text: The 2018 version of "A Star Is Born" is notable because it contains some impressive "firsts" for two of our galaxy's brightest performers.
reviews.author: Mathew DeKinder

reviews.text: Though this may not be much of a shock to longtime fans, for those of us who associate Lady Gaga with outlandish public appearances in meat dresses, her soulful down-to-earth performance in this film is borderline revelatory.
reviews.author: Josh Terry

reviews.text: Little jabs of pleasure give way to something less tingly, safer: nods of admiration. Torquing Susan Sontag's definition of camp as "seriousness that fails," I think of Cooper's movie as seriousness that succeeds, but perhaps too well or too cleanly.
reviews.author: Melissa Anderson

reviews.text: Songs age, too, into eulogies for euphoria or suicide notes for security. They die. They're reborn. Over and over. That sense of decay and renewal boldly rests deep in the bones, performances and storytelling of one of the year's best films.
reviews.author: Nick Rogers

reviews.text: Lady Gaga is a radiant, natural actor, and she knocks her first lead movie performance way-far out of the park.
reviews.author: Kurt Loder

reviews.text: [Their love] shines through the performances and music with relevant lyrics proving crucial to their characters' mindsets and our emotional reaction to what occurs.
reviews.author: Jared Mobarak

reviews.text: Believe some, not all, of the hype.
reviews.author: Christian Toto

reviews.text: Cooper takes us along for an engaging ride. And one filled with solid direction, even better performances from the leads, and a killer soundtrack featuring some incredible new songs. (Full Content Review - Profanity, Nudity, etc. - also Available)
reviews.author: Jim Judy

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper outshines Lady Gaga in competent retread.
reviews.author: Sonny Bunch

reviews.text: I will go out on a short limb to predict Academy Award nods to Cooper, Gaga and Elliott. Lady Gaga's days of wearing a meat dress are history. A born movie star is she.
reviews.author: Steve Crum

reviews.text: I can't recommend this film enough and can't imagine anyone not being bowled over by it.
reviews.author: Jamie East

reviews.text: This is a dazzlingly original silver-screen debut.
reviews.author: Brian Viner

reviews.text: Unabashed melodrama...the film's strongest moments are acoustic, not plugged-in...intimate, truth-telling exchanges between lovers who want the best for each other.
reviews.author: Peter Canavese

reviews.text: "A Star is Born" dazzles.
reviews.author: Linda Cook

reviews.text: When this movie really hums, it's about Cooper the actor and director supporting those who are supporting him.
reviews.author: Adam Kempenaar

reviews.text: In spite of a momentous directorial debut and performance from Bradley Cooper, Lady Gaga leaves the lasting impression in A Star Is Born, a beautiful production perfectly suited to re-release the superstar as a top-tier performer.
reviews.author: Luke Parker

reviews.text: There's a reason they keep making A Star Is Born. As long as you tell this story, you're going to have a good movie. This is not my favorite A Star is Born (that would belong to Barbra) but it's definitely in my top three Star is Borns.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: "A Star is Born" isn't perfect, but what Cooper and Gaga are able to do with the tale make it a delicate love story and triumphant tribute to the artistic spirit.
reviews.author: Adam Graham

reviews.text: It's so alive with raw heartache and intoxicating performances it feels like a story no one's ever told before.
reviews.author: Alistair Harkness

reviews.text: [A] creaking, ego driven and tone deaf musical drama.
reviews.author: Chris Hunneysett

reviews.text: We're not watching. We're diving in with her - and ascending to an insta-stardom that feels real, not contrived.
reviews.author: Tim Appelo

reviews.text: A perfectly acceptable drama with some great songs and performances but little more.
reviews.author: Steve Katz

reviews.text: Cooper has managed to do the impossible. He's put together an instant movie classic that will have audiences falling in love with his brand new creation.
reviews.author: Mark Daniell

reviews.text: This movie is an effulgent treat. The songs are terrific and the concert scenes alone are worth the price of admission. Cooper shows Oscar(r) quality as director, actor and co-writer of songs.
reviews.author: Tony Medley

reviews.text: The good news is that this generation gets a pretty good version of the story.
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: Cooper's leisurely approach builds no momentum, and the non-musical scenes meander as the actors (apparently) improvise in close-up. This isn't storytelling as much as it is a work-shopped series of behaviors.
reviews.author: Robert Horton

reviews.text: It is maudlin, earnest and unfashionably melodramatic. It is too long. It is self-serious. And it is really, truly great.
reviews.author: Calum Marsh

reviews.text: Perhaps this is one of those songs that's been sung once or twice too often.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: Were the actor Bradley Cooper not so tender and hard-working in his performance as the jaded rocker Jackson Maine, it would be possible to regard the whole thing as a vanity project, since he co-wrote and directed it also.
reviews.author: Ryan Gilbey

reviews.text: It's Cooper's first time as director and Gaga's first major movie role, but you'd never guess it from the skill and passion they bring to the project.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: In A Star Is Born, love hurts. But it's labor that breaks your heart.
reviews.author: Noah Berlatsky

reviews.text: This A Star Is Born is like movie night at the rehab clinic: all the shame of drunkenness and none of the elation.
reviews.author: Richard von Busack

reviews.text: With A Star Is Born, Lady Gaga nails those 12 notes. And she takes it up a key, too.
reviews.author: Kevin Fallon

reviews.text: When you go into seeing A Star Is Born, one thing is always clear: You're in for great music and a broken heart.
reviews.author: Rachel Leishman

reviews.text: Lady Gaga delivers a movie musical performance that's fresh, funny, and at times powerful.
reviews.author: André Hereford

reviews.text: Everything feels comfortably familiar, yet halfway through this plate of pleasing nostalgia and orchestrated pathos, you realize there's not much substance between the focaccia. We may love our two leads but their characters never feel entirely developed.
reviews.author: Katherine Monk

reviews.text: A Star is Born is American mainstream cinema at its very finest.
reviews.author: Tom Fitzgerald and Lorenzo Marquez

reviews.text: Lady Gaga supplies an astonishing work of transparent, transporting joy, a frayed electrical wire of emotion with the voice of an earthy angel. She complements Cooper's sexy, sensitive, pugnacious and powerful Star is Born.
reviews.author: Dann Gire

reviews.text: For Cooper, it's a polished directorial debut. For Gaga, it's as comfortable a bridge from pop stardom into the movie world as one could imagine. As duets go, that's the sort of combined star power that's difficult to beat.
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: But, but, but... I did cry, and Lady Gaga is truly sensational, fabulous, a revelation. I had no idea.
reviews.author: Deborah Ross

reviews.text: A Star is Born isn't a perfect movie, but it is a darned entertaining one.
reviews.author: Michael Smith

reviews.text: The result is a richly layered, laugh-and-cry love story that understands that audiences must love the characters before they buy their love affair.
reviews.author: John Lui

reviews.text: This is the best work Cooper has done as an actor since The Silver Linings Playbook, and his directorial debut suggests the brightest of futures behind the lens. As for Gaga, well, she steals the show.
reviews.author: Harry Guerin

reviews.text: The glory of this version of A Star Is Born is in how this movie star is born through the deconstruction of the pop star playing her.
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: [Gag's] enchanting to watch, while the chemistry between her and Cooper is mesmerising. You'll fall in love with them falling in love and that goes a long way in carrying you through the movie's slightly sketchier second half.
reviews.author: Larushka Ivan-Zadeh

reviews.text: Having already established himself as one of the best actors of his day, Cooper outdoes himself here, performing additional roles behind the scenes. None of his tasks are given short shrift, and his casting of Lady Gaga leads to an inspired performance.
reviews.author: Marjorie Baumgarten

reviews.text: Cooper has produced a film worthy of the moniker A STAR IS BORN, both for him as first-time director and Lady Gaga for her first starring role. They are marvelous --- and a whole new generation will get to appreciate this classic tale.
reviews.author: Jeanne Kaplan

reviews.text: Beautifully acted and intelligently written, A STAR IS BORN is an ambitious, even monumental achievement in filmmaking.
reviews.author: David Kaplan

reviews.text: What prevails is a commitment to the material that goes well beyond vanity-project interests, as well as a dogged affection for these two flickering flames that burned more brightly as one.
reviews.author: Rubén Rosario

reviews.text: Lady Gaga, remarkable in her first leading movie role, charms as the pre-fame Ally and deftly portrays her transformation. Her mighty pipes leave no question regarding Ally's talent.
reviews.author: Anita Katz

reviews.text: Whatever my feelings about the overall plot, at least I found this new iteration well-directed and -acted ... Count this qualified appreciated as a semi-endorsement, then.
reviews.author: Christopher Llewellyn Reed

reviews.text: He's [Cooper] left all of that passion on the screen and once the credits roll, you know exactly why it was worth touching this material again.
reviews.author: Matthew Passantino

reviews.text: This is the kind of movie everybody says they don't make anymore.
reviews.author: Sean Burns

reviews.text: The role of Ally is so meta as to cast doubt on whether Lady Gaga can play other kinds of parts; the performance is so galvanizing that you don't remotely care.
reviews.author: Ty Burr

reviews.text: It feels somehow compact despite its sprawling two-hour-and-15-minute size, with nary a scene or frame wasted as it builds to its inexorable yet heart-shattering finale.
reviews.author: Dana Stevens

reviews.text: (Cooper) continually - and wisely - puts her in the spotlight, allowing the camera to caress Gaga. Many times Cooper tracks his camera in on Gaga's face, emphasizing her eyes, which - in this case - are windows to her soul.
reviews.author: Bob Bloom

reviews.text: Achingly honest.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: An impressive debut from Cooper, not only for his direction but also how he elevates himself as an actor to keep up with his perfectly cast co-star.
reviews.author: Edward Douglas

reviews.text: It's no surprise that Gaga shines brightest when she's performing, but that's not just because she's got a generational voice.
reviews.author: Brad Keefe

reviews.text: This is a walking, talking, singing, and a note for note cliché. I enjoyed it, yes, but the beats, the aching melodrama, cornball lines, passages and action are past their prime. They missed a great opportunity to show some originality.
reviews.author: Anne Brodie

reviews.text: As well as turning Gaga into the next hot big screen commodity, Cooper crafts a film that shines brightest when it needs to, ending on a stirring, emotionally-captivating and indescribably powerful note.
reviews.author: Nathan Osborne

reviews.text: Like its finest antecedents, it wrings tears from its romance and thrills from a steadfast belief in old-fashioned, big-feeling cinema. That it's also a perverse fantasy about men, women, love and sacrifice makes it all the better.
reviews.author: Manohla Dargis

reviews.text: Just TV-commercial pathos and huggy redemption.
reviews.author: Kelly Vance

reviews.text: A Star Is Born is a good show. But it's not blazingly original or truly transcendent. We hear the echoes of what came before.
reviews.author: Tim Grierson

reviews.text: For all the predictions I've heard about this latest version being either great or terrible, I have to say it lands in between, though thankfully much closer to the former than the latter.
reviews.author: Kristian M. Lin

reviews.text: A Star is Born is a series of cliches that work well together. When the music is playing and Cooper and Gaga sing, it's magic.
reviews.author: Kristen Lopez

reviews.text: A remarkable, addictive piece of Hollywood myth-making that deserves to be seen on the biggest screen and in the loudest theater possible.
reviews.author: Todd Gilchrist

reviews.text: This is the best Star Is Born yet, and one of the best movies of the year.
reviews.author: Richard Roeper

reviews.text: A Star Is Born is perfectly fine, escapist entertainment. Just don't expect any encores.
reviews.author: J.R. Kinnard

reviews.text: An astonishingly confident directorial debut from Cooper. The concert scenes are alternatively soulful and boot-stomping, but never anything less than arresting, and the snippets of backstage life crackle with authenticity.
reviews.author: Max Weiss

reviews.text: Cooper and Gaga both infuse an energy and authenticity within [their characters] that gives their blossoming relationship organic growth.
reviews.author: Robert Daniels

reviews.text: In the next A Star Is Born we surely need a story reborn. This one is getting past its reincarnate-by date.
reviews.author: Nigel Andrews

reviews.text: A Star Is Born, is simply terrific -- a big-scale cinematic delight that will have the masses singing, swooning and sobbing along with it.
reviews.author: Lindsey Bahr

reviews.text: ...an all-out weepie, and something of a false one.
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: Cooper and Gaga have voices worth listening to, especially when they're harmonizing in front of a crowd of thousands. We just wish the narrative mixed in a few more sharps and flats to ensure a clearly distinct sound and experience.
reviews.author: Kiko Martinez

reviews.text: What ultimately makes "A Star Is Born" such a pleasure is that it works on every level - the direction, the acting, the music, the casting.
reviews.author: Ross Raihala

reviews.text: First-time director Cooper and co-star Gaga make beautiful music together in this glossy update of a Hollywood classic.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: For the movie to work, the music has to be believable as commercially viable entity, and for the most part it does.
reviews.author: Gary Thompson

reviews.text: Every generation needs its Star, and the latest version - starring Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga - is a worthwhile addition to the series.
reviews.author: Cameron Meier

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper has a lot to say in this effective, beautifully made movie.
reviews.author: Joanna Langfield

reviews.text: No acting is required from Cooper and the accompanying band when [Lady Gaga] takes the stage. Like them, you will be in awe.
reviews.author: Joanne Soh

reviews.text: Even the most hard-hearted and cynical viewer is likely to have an emotional reaction, and this is as much a testimony to the way Cooper tells the tale as to the story itself.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: Cooper deserves the accolades, but it's Gaga people will be talking about as they leave the theater.
reviews.author: Clint O'Connor

reviews.text: Cooper's version of Star is like a perfect white t-shirt or a nice bowl spaghetti.
reviews.author: Hannah Lynn

reviews.text: A blockbuster romance that looks and feels like an indie film, all in service of an expression of pure love.
reviews.author: Katie Walsh

reviews.text: Gaga is a real surprise in a demanding role. She never feels like she's acting, and brings the character right into the songs.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: It's a story of rock stars and A-list fame told in small moments and claustrophobic shouting matches, an epic made small to moving effect.
reviews.author: Dominick Suzanne-Mayer

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper's A Star Is Born is brazen widescreen craft that goes for the throat and makes no bones about wanting to leave you a sopping wet mass of tears by the time its credits roll.
reviews.author: Jacob Knight

reviews.text: The fact that Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga have such a good contrast, is worth every second on film. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ruben Peralta Rigaud

reviews.text: The actors' support for each other translates on screen as real communion and their musical performances together are the film's highlight.
reviews.author: Laura Clifford

reviews.text: The meandering narrative lays a near flawless foundation for a love story centered around finding one's artistic soul.
reviews.author: Jonathan W. Hickman

reviews.text: A Star is Born is aptly titled--Lady Gaga has arrived. A movie star is born.
reviews.author: Neil Pond

reviews.text: Like Barbra Streisand and Whitney Houston before her, Gaga is on her way to becoming more than just a singer who occasionally acts.
reviews.author: Travis Hopson

reviews.text: The result is a product formatted for fans of the Grammys and the Oscars, but it also lets us see the annoying narcissistic drive of its director and protagonist. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlos F. Heredero

reviews.text: Passionate, emotional and fearless, the gangbusters "A Star Is Born" is poised to become the movie of the moment - the one everyone has to see right now.
reviews.author: Kenneth Turan

reviews.text: By dumping the usual Hollywood bull for something that feels raw, scrappy and lived in, Cooper and Gaga knock it out of the park. Their movie, one of the year's very best, is a modern musical classic. The Oscar race is officially on.
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: The film feels fresh from thunderous start to exquisite finish.
reviews.author: Joe Morgenstern

reviews.text: Cooper and his cast and crew aim high and almost hits the mark but, to me, falls short of its aspiration to be the best "A Star Is Born."
reviews.author: Robin Clifford

reviews.text: Cooper's debut outing at the helm is a thoroughly convincing one in almost every respect. In terms of chemistry, a rich natural register is struck between the duo that makes them transfixing to behold.
reviews.author: Hilary A White

reviews.text: I was blown away by the stellar performances and the original takes on the story
reviews.author: Raquel Stecher

reviews.text: Like a classic love song, the film is meant to tug your heart strings. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: María Fernanda Mugica

reviews.text: [A] magnificent, emotional, beautiful production that entertains and thrills you while it makes you laugh and cheer, but also while it makes you cry and breaks your heart.
reviews.author: Mark Hughes

reviews.text: The story may be more than a little hoary but at its best moments, it reminds you that just because something is old and predictable does not mean that it cannot also be entertaining and ultimately satisfying as well.
reviews.author: Peter Sobczynski

reviews.text: Lady Gaga has traveled by egg, donned skirt steak and taken part in a TV blood orgy. But her biggest transformation occurs in the new film "A Star Is Born." In it, she becomes an Oscar-worthy actress.
reviews.author: Johnny Oleksinski

reviews.text: I just loved it. It's a film that combines an overall feeling of modernity and relevance with the glow of old-time glamour.
reviews.author: Mick LaSalle

reviews.text: Instantly sweeps us up in its passion, its electricity, its music, and characters to fall in love with. Lady Gaga is a revelation. It's impossible to believe Bradley Cooper has never directed before. I adore this movie.
reviews.author: MaryAnn Johanson

reviews.text: Somehow, Cooper has made a Hollywood fairy tale seem utterly believable and magical at the same time.
reviews.author: Randy Cordova

reviews.text: Cooper, in his directing debut, puts us inside the music and the drama and lets it swirl around us.
reviews.author: Moira MacDonald

reviews.text: It is made for a big screen, big sound and the comforting sorrow of the communal sob.Maybe we really do need another version of A Star is Born.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: With their phenomenal "A Star Is Born," Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper upend expectations and spectacularly freshen up a stock Hollywood story.
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: ... this update of the classic love story is crafted with a palpable affection and passion. Cooper's take is personal, ingenious, and raw.
reviews.author: Chris Feil

reviews.text: The result is pure Saturday-night moviegoing: it gives you one hell of a wallop, then you wake up on Sunday morning without a scratch.
reviews.author: Anthony Lane

reviews.text: Lady Gaga excels as a diluted version of herself in a moving a promising directorial debut from powerhouse Bradley Cooper. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Orlando Maldonado

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper updates "A Star Is Born" on the wings of a luminous talent. Pop diva Lady Gaga is electric on screen.
reviews.author: Julian Roman

reviews.text: Sit back, fall in love, and let it wash over you. Watch a star being born
reviews.author: Frank Wilkins

reviews.text: This version stands on its own. It is enjoyable romp and there are some emotional moments that deliver a jolt but that is it. I wish Hollywood studios would stop with the remakes.
reviews.author: Rosalynn Try-Hane

reviews.text: A Star Is Born is a resounding success. The concert scenes are particularly impressive... It's intimate, and sweaty, and loud.
reviews.author: Anne Cohen

reviews.text: Fueled by strong performances and Cooper's precise direction, A Star is Born is a moving (and tear-jerking) love story by way of showbiz melodrama.
reviews.author: Sandy Schaefer

reviews.text: Absolutely LOVED this. Bradley Cooper is just sensational. A juggernaut assault on the emotions. Pack tissues.
reviews.author: Kat Hughes

reviews.text: An enormously satisfying and well-tuned blockbuster gala musical; a vibrant, up-to-date Supertrouper crackling with happiness and heartbreak, sprinkled with stardust and star-maker gumption.
reviews.author: Alan Jones

reviews.text: This film grapples with fame, family, integrity, love and sacrifice. It succeeed emphatically in conveying the overwhelming love its two central characters feel.
reviews.author: Stefan Kyriazis

reviews.text: What makes Cooper so good is that he directs in a way that encourages you not to see what he is doing, but what is happening. Character above all.
reviews.author: Olly Richards

reviews.text: "Joanne" demonstrated [Gaga's] range as a vocalist and musician, yet received largely middling reviews. But it did hint at her potential legacy-evolving into an artist as skilled as Prince. A STAR IS BORN cements that legacy.
reviews.author: Rubin Safaya

reviews.text: Handsomely mounted and profoundly felt at times, becoming an "Actors Studio: The Movie" take on music world misery.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: It's full of old-fashioned movie magic, with Bradley Cooper knocking it out of the park in his directorial debut, and Lady Gaga bringing it, and not just with her singing.
reviews.author: Stephen Silver

reviews.text: The first half is much better than the second half, but it still works as a compelling romantic tragedy.
reviews.author: Scott Mendelson

reviews.text: "A Star is Born" offers a suitably jaundiced glimpse of starmaking machinery at its most cynical, but also its most thrilling and gratifying.
reviews.author: Ann Hornaday

reviews.text: Not unlike Boogie Nights, the highs in A Star Is Born (ie: the first half) are very high, while the lows (the latter half) include drawn-out and repetitive elements that are so telegraphed and predictable they simply feel sad.
reviews.author: Joe Lipsett

reviews.text: This soul-baring, emotionally propulsive work proves that Cooper is just as much of a dynamo behind the camera as he is in front of it.
reviews.author: Courtney Howard

reviews.text: Lady Gaga can act, very well, and actor Bradley Cooper can direct -- even better.
reviews.author: Lapacazo Magrira Sandoval

reviews.text: An uneven work of startling sincerity and disarming beauty.
reviews.author: Kelley Dong

reviews.text: The excitement of the film's first hour is sacrificed for a more cliched permanent stay in its second. Gaga takes over and Bradley takes a backseat; gone is the dynamic that made the first half so electrifying and enticing
reviews.author: Jordan Ruimy

reviews.text: Somewhere inside this good 135-minute film is an even better 120-minute movie.
reviews.author: Dwight Brown

reviews.text: Cooper and Gaga are irresistibly charming together consistently bringing out the best in each other, eliciting palpable trust both as on-screen characters and world-class stars comfortable in one another's shoes. Nothing is faked, everything is remarkable
reviews.author: Robert Kojder

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper's feature directorial debut, A Star Is Born, knocks it out of the park thanks to a stellar performance from Lady Gaga.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: The kind of film that no one is going to stop talking about for months, because very few people will have anything bad to say about it.
reviews.author: Tomas Trussow

reviews.text: Maybe we've seen it before, heard the music and felt how love burns, how inescapable self-destruction hurts. But there's no taking away from what the marriage of these moments has created, the importance of all these new stars shining so bright.
reviews.author: Ella Kemp

reviews.text: While it's not a perfect film - though the first hour just may be - A Star Is Born boasts more than enough passion to make up for some of its narrative hiccups.
reviews.author: Alissa Wilkinson

reviews.text: "All you gotta do is trust me," he tells her, and when he brings her out on stage, and then brings her up to the front microphone, it raises the same kind of gooseflesh as the "When Your Mind's Made Up" scene in Once.
reviews.author: Jason Bailey

reviews.text: Cooper's feat of filmmaking puts him on a par with great American actors turned auteurs like Clint Eastwood and Warren Beatty.
reviews.author: Allan Hunter

reviews.text: Proves there is still plenty of life left in this tale of fame, addiction, and sacrifice. "A Star Is Born" is an emotionally intimate journey that makes itself feel like an event. An astonishing Lady Gaga positively soars.
reviews.author: Dustin Putman

reviews.text: Lady Gaga will get the attention, but Bradley Cooper steals the show.
reviews.author: Max Covill

reviews.text: Gaga keeps the film's heart pumping. She's down-to-Earth and radiant-in other words, every bit as good as everyone has been saying.
reviews.author: A.A. Dowd

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga are this year's Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone.
reviews.author: Scott Menzel

reviews.text: Cooper gives his heroes highly personal issues: his sanity and his music for Jack, and her sense of self-worth for Ally.
reviews.author: Manuela Lazic

reviews.text: The supporting roles in A Star Is Born are equally wonderful, and some in surprising ways. Sam Elliott remains a genius.
reviews.author: Andy Howell

reviews.text: Lady Gaga triumphs as a young woman averse to artifice and fame-hounding. The movie is a hell of a magic act.
reviews.author: David Edelstein

reviews.text: Overall, this movie is a testament to the talent of Cooper, but the glory belongs to Gaga.
reviews.author: Patrik Sandberg

reviews.text: A Star Is Born is a refreshing take of this classic showbiz rise and fall tale, with updated character work, fantastic performances by Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga, and a soundtrack that will be stuck in your head for days.
reviews.author: Rafael Motamayor

reviews.text: A Star is Born doesn't deviate too wildly from the frequently remade storyline, but everything else about Cooper's film feels refreshed and new.
reviews.author: Andrew Parker

reviews.text: Gaga is truly immense throughout, delivering a wonderfully grounded and subtle performance with bursts of that electricity that has so invigoratingly defined her pop career.
reviews.author: Caitlin Quinlan

reviews.text: It's valid to ask whether a movie needs to be made a fourth time, but Cooper's fantastic, emotional film demonstrates how execution, style, and a modern point of view can make even the most familiar story fresh again.
reviews.author: Bryan Bishop

reviews.text: A turn that has a semblance of Nicolas Cage in "Leaving Las Vegas" and Joaquin Phoenix in "Walk the Line," Cooper constructs his own creation, echoing and respecting the role that has been crafted by March, Mason, and Kristofferson.
reviews.author: Clayton Davis

reviews.text: It's not adding anything new to the Star is Born canon, but it is a solid retelling for a new generation.
reviews.author: Sarah Marrs

reviews.text: Their chemistry is undeniable, their duets infectious and moving the action into the contemporary music scene, where Ally is rapidly reconfigured as a sequin-studded red head flanked by unnecessary dancers, strikes a long line of emotional notes.
reviews.author: Kate Taylor

reviews.text: You can see where all of it is headed from two miles away. But that doesn't matter, not when Bradley Cooper is executing the formula so well.
reviews.author: Angie Han

reviews.text: Cooper and Lady Gaga pull off a remarkable feat-they not only make you believe the characters are actually falling in love.
reviews.author: John Powers

reviews.text: An invigorating paean to the joys of making art, the momentum that comes with sudden inspiration, and how swooningly romantic it can all feel.
reviews.author: David Sims

reviews.text: A film that dares to go big, bold and sincere, classical, modern and haphazard in equal measures. It may not go down as one of the greats but like many a song over the decades, when the right note in the film swings big, it soars.
reviews.author: Allyson Johnson

reviews.text: Great music, great performances, a doomed love story with plenty of heart on display, A Star Is Born really is a triumph, a reminder that sometimes playing the hits can really bring the house down.
reviews.author: Jason Gorber

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper makes an outstanding directorial debut and Lady Gaga proves herself a movie star in this electrifying remake of an oft-told show-business tale.
reviews.author: Kevin Lally

reviews.text: Superb. Gaga and Cooper deliver Oscar-worthy turns in a remake that hits the high notes.
reviews.author: James Mottram

reviews.text: Cooper's film proves that a love story this timeless still works when done right.
reviews.author: Oliver Whitney

reviews.text: It's remarkable... just how many fresh reserves of emotion Cooper teases out of a well-worn formula.
reviews.author: Justin Chang

reviews.text: Cooper uses Hollywood's favorite creation myth to recreate how audiences will forever perceive him and Gaga.
reviews.author: David Crow

reviews.text: Cooper seems at once fired up by the meet-cute potential of the premise, which he nails, and stuck at a creative crossroads with the more melancholy, sepia-toned stuff that probably first drew the previously-attached Clint Eastwood's attention.
reviews.author: Angelo Muredda

reviews.text: The film is a proper double hander, divided between Gaga and Cooper, but it also provides an excellent platform for Cooper to show off all the directorial tricks he's picked up from his long acting career.
reviews.author: Kayleigh Donaldson

reviews.text: Bradley Cooper makes an impressive directing debut with A Star Is Born, turning one of Hollywood's most re-made movies into something fresh and soulful, even though it's hampered by some of the story's clichés.
reviews.author: Karen Gordon

reviews.text: Believe the hype. Cooper is a born director and Lady Gaga is superb.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: This story has been told several times before-and influenced other similar romances-but Cooper and Gaga find a way to make this feel fresh and new.
reviews.author: Brian Tallerico

reviews.text: The familiar story of an aging performer discovering a rising star gets a fresh coat of paint, and excels primarily due to the performance (and musical talents) of Lady Gaga.
reviews.author: Chris Evangelista

reviews.text: Cooper has made a remarkably self-assured feature debut anchored by an outstanding lead performance from Lady Gaga.
reviews.author: Matt Goldberg

reviews.text: The occasional bum note aside, this is broad-strokes filmmaking of the highest calibre.
reviews.author: Paul O'Callaghan

synopsis: Seasoned musician Jackson Maine discovers -- and falls in love with -- struggling artist Ally. She has just about given up on her dream to make it big as a singer until Jackson coaxes her into the spotlight. But even as Ally's career takes off, the personal side of their relationship is breaking down, as Jackson fights an ongoing battle with his own internal demons.
